Articles.Content:
Alright, seed you Tuesday.

Okay you really want to rephrase that...

Okay you really want to rephrase that...

you saw nothing.... I didn't accidentally put a d anywhere >.<

Edit: My typos are over 9000 >.>

Edited May 26, 2015 by StrahmDude

you say nothing.... I didn't accidently put a d anywhere >.<

Do not put a d anywhere near me

Do not put a d anywhere near me

Hahaha

Do not put a d anywhere near me

See you next week. (there isn't even one letter of the fourth letter of the alphabet in my reply)

Edited May 27, 2015 by StrahmDude

There was One message with a D which is the 4th letter of the Alphabet, 4-1=3, What shape has 3 sides?

A Triangle....

PHOENIX IS THE ILLUMINATI CONFIRMED!

There was One message with a D which is the 4th letter of the Alphabet, 4-1=3, What shape has 3 sides?

A Triangle....

PHOENIX IS THE ILLUMINATI CONFIRMED!

Damn, he figured it out. Now I am going to have to call on my anonymous friends to delete these posts and delay the development of half life 3, portal 3, and team fortress 3.....

wow weird timing... Just before macey dean returned. subsequently i have been doing a similar thing. i have 2 vids up on it. id love to join in on what your doing.

this one is cool and not informational

This one is boring strange and informational (mildly)

give me a holler if you want to fight me. or work together. I'm easy.

wow weird timing... Just before macey dean returned. subsequently i have been doing a similar thing. i have 2 vids up on it. id love to join in on what your doing.

this one is cool and not informational

This one is boring strange and informational (mildly)

give me a holler if you want to fight me. or work together. I'm easy.

We have been trying to fight each other but our ships continue to slide in their orbits and collide >.<

It is REALLY annoying. We even tried it with save trading and it still occurred. I have a new respect for what Macey does.

We would LOVE to fight you, but we can't even fight each other >.>

We think it's because we use hyper edit to save ourselves hours of time.

Edited June 1, 2015 by StrahmDude
Any other mods besides hyperedit because the naval battles don't run into this but those saves are only traded 12 or so times.

Any other mods besides hyperedit because the naval battles don't run into this but those saves are only traded 12 or so times.

Just hyperedit and maybe darkmultiplayer to avoid save trading. I don't understand the rest of what you are trying to say.
Just wondering why you're having this issue so much. I've ran into it once or twice but not as much as you're saying, wondering what's different.

Just hyperedit and maybe darkmultiplayer to avoid save trading. I don't understand the rest of what you are trying to say.

You try setting it up. Also we've only shared it once and it went to $h!t

- - - Updated - - -

Just wondering why you're having this issue so much. I've ran into it once or twice but not as much as you're saying, wondering what's different.

I'm so sick of it, if it doesn't get fixed then I'll probably stop playing KSP for a while.

You try setting it up. Also we've only shared it once and it went to $h!t

- - - Updated - - -

I'm so sick of it, if it doesn't get fixed then I'll probably stop playing KSP for a while.

I think the best course of action would be to uninstall all the mods, then reinstall just hyper edit, and do save trading on a different save, It's a fresh start that may fix it.

Also in case anybody didn't know, on this new save we could maybe attempt to roll it back to KSP 1.0, I'm using 1.0.2 atm but it's only bug fixes, and Hyperedit's latest release says it's for 1.0

Edited June 2, 2015 by Caldari Navy

I think the best course of action would be to uninstall all the mods, then reinstall just hyper edit, and do save trading on a different save, It's a fresh start that may fix it.

Also in case anybody didn't know, on this new save we could maybe attempt to roll it back to KSP 1.0, I'm using 1.0.2 atm but it's only bug fixes, and Hyperedit's latest release says it's for 1.0

We have updated hyperedit and it still occurred, and rolling back, if possible, might fix it because I don't remember encountering it early on.

We have updated hyperedit and it still occurred, and rolling back, if possible, might fix it because I don't remember encountering it early on.
